intro: Didelta obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved didelta, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves with a slightly rounded tip and smooth, waxy surfaces. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Didelta obtusifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
